basics.name: Sandesh Lamsal
basics.label: Structural Engineer
basics.summary: A Nepal-born structural engineer, from designing earthquake resistant building to coastal resillient structures

work.name: Civil and Architectural Engineering, University of Miami
work.summary: Working in morphological investigation and physical testing of Submerged Structures at the University of Miami Alfred C. Glassell, Jr. Surge-Structure-Atmosphere Interaction (SUSTAIN) Laboratory with Dr. Landolf Rhode Barbarigos and Dr. Brian Haus.

work.name: Texas Tech University
work.summary: Teaching Assistant in Undergrad Subjects (Statics, Construction Materials Laboratory).

Involvement.organization: Civil Engineering Students' Society, National College of Engineering
Involvement.summary: Served as a Secretary from January 2015 to August 2017. Organized AutoCAD Training for Freshmen and Sophomores.
highlights: Organized AutoCAD Training for Freshmen and Sophomores.
Participated in National Civil Competition with a Parking Solution at New Road, Kathmandu.

activities: Member of TTU ASCE Students Society
Design of Bridge as a final year project
Secretary at National College of Civil Engineering Studentâ€™s Society

awards.title: Engaged Scholarship Award
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding engagement in scholarship activities of $1000.

awards.title: Edward E. Whitacre Jr. College of Engineering Merit Based Award
awards.summary: Merit-based award for academic excellence during the 2021-2022 academic year of 1500$.

publications.name: Quantifying Wave Energy Dissipation in Perforated Breakwater Structures: An Experimental Study with Porous Hexagonal SEAHIVE Configurations
publications.summary: This paper discusses the quantification of wave energy dissipation in perforated breakwater structures. It presents an experimental study with porous hexagonal SEAHIVE configurations.

publications.name: Reefense: Design Considerations in Developing Low-Crested Structures with Reef Restoration for Coastal Defense
publications.summary: This paper discusses the design considerations in developing low-crested structures with reef restoration for coastal defense. It presents the concept of Reefense.

references.name: Dr. Brian Haus
references.reference: Professor & Department Chair of Ocean Sciences, University of Miami

references.name: Dr. Landolf Rhode-Barbarigos
references.reference: Associate Professor, Department of Civil, Architectural and Environmental Engineering, University of Miami
